description.narrative: Colombian Climate Asset Disclosure Initiative (CCADI, year 1) will have raised awareness within the government, investors and civil society on the importance and mutual benefits of engaging institutional investors in climate smart investment; as well as provided asset owners with context specific information and recommendations that, together with enhanced capacities as a result of their engagement and the skill sharing aspects of the project, will put them in a position to act on the recommendations in an upward spiral catalysed by the ranking that can be followed up by relevant stakeholders in the country.

Ultimately, the first year of the CCADI aims at catalysing an upward spiral prompted by the rating and ranking of asset owners, and enabled by context specific information, barriers, recommendations and capacity building, in a context of increased awareness from various stakeholders.

title.narrative: Through the series of skill sharing workshops (Output 2) the project will ensure that CCADI is built on lessons learned and best practices of existing experience, in particular that of the UK, while engaging with key stakeholders at the national level that will provide the information and local experience that allows CCADI to bring clear value added to the Colombian context specifically. The peer to peer workshops will also be a key component in building the capacity of national asset owners to implement the recommendations and necessary changes that will improve their consideration of climate risks and opportunities in investing decision-making, contributing to the national efforts towards complying with the NDC. The initiative will aim at creating an environment where the CCADI is seen as both a business opportunity to improve investing decision-making processes, and an opportunity for trust in the financial system to increase. 2.
